thread.title: Lonzo Ball helps No. 9 UCLA get revenge against No. 6 Oregon at home

title: Lonzo Ball helps No. 9 UCLA get revenge against No. 6 Oregon at home

text:

Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Lonzo Ball helps No. 9 UCLA get revenge against No. 6 Oregon at home USA TODAY Sports Published 11:58 p.m. ET Feb. 9, 2017 | Updated 3 minutes ago UCLA Bruins guard Bryce Alford (20) reacts after making a shot against the Oregon Ducks during the first half at Pauley Pavilion. (Photo: Kelvin Kuo, USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
No. 9 UCLA needed an epic rally to knock off No. 6 UCLA at home. 
The Bruins stormed back from a 19-point deficit to beat the Ducks 82-79 and avoid a season-sweep after losing to Oregon on a last-second shot in December. 
Freshman Lonzo Ball led the Bruins with 15 points and 11 rebounds. 
The Ducks were led by Dillon Brooks, who tallied 19 points. Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Steve Mitchell, USA TODAY Sports Wake Forest Demon Deacons forward John Collins (20) shoots the ball as Notre Dame Fighting Irish forward Bonzie Colson (35) defends in the first half at the Purcell Pavilion. The Fighting Irish won 88-81. Penn State defeated Maryland 70-64. Villanova defeated Georgetown 75-64. Memphis Tigers defeated the Tulsa Golden Hurricane 66-44. Justin Ford, USA TODAY Sports Kentucky Wildcats guard De'Aaron Fox (0) shoots the ball against LSU Tigers guard Brandon Sampson (0) in the second half at Rupp Arena. Kentucky defeated LSU 92-85. Mark Zerof, USA TODAY Sports Michigan State Spartans forward Nick Ward (44) is defended by Michigan Wolverines forward Moritz Wagner (13) in the second half at Crisler Center. Michigan won 86-57. Rick Osentoski, USA TODAY Sports Butler Bulldogs forward Andrew Chrabascz (45) shoots under pressure from Marquette Golden Eagles center Luke Fischer (40) during the second half at BMO Harris Bradley Center. Butler won 68-65. Jeff Hanisch, USA TODAY Sports Virginia Cavaliers guard Devon Hall (0) shoots the ball as Louisville Cardinals guard Donovan Mitchell (45) defends in the first half at John Paul Jones Arena. The Cavaliers won 71-55. The Cavaliers won 71-55. Johnson (4) defend during the first half at Fred Bramlage Coliseum. The Jayhawks won the game, 74-71. Scott Sewell, USA TODAY Sports Florida State guard Terance Mann dunks during the first half against the Clemson Tigers.
